alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:51PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Tuolumne, northwestern Alpine, eastern El Dorado, northeastern Calaveras and northeastern Amador Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 450 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kirkwood Meadows, or over Kirkwood. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carson Pass, Kirkwood, Bear Valley, Lake Alpine, Kirkwood Meadows, Upper Blue Lake, Kirkwood Ski Area, Kit Carson and Hermit Valley Basin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
